Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Model

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.observe.Observable<NotifyMessages>
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Model
public class Model
extends Observable<NotifyMessages>
This class contains an instance of Gameboard and schedules players' turns. It has all the information regarding the state of the game

  • Constructor Details

    • Model

      public Model​(int numberOfPlayers)
      the gameboard object and turnInfo object are instantiated. Player red starts, therefore the turn is assigned to him If there are only two players, the third inexisting player is set as already eliminated from the game Complete deck is initialized so that it contains all the possible godCards, and the gameDeck is created (it will contain the cards chosen for the game)
      Parameters:
      numberOfPlayers - is the number of players in the game

      public void assignColour​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players)
      this function assigns colours to the players in the game
      Parameters:

    • assignColour2

      private void assignColour2​(Player player1, Player player2)
      this function assigns colours to the players passed, from the youngest to the oldest
      Parameters:
      player1 - is the first player
      player2 - is the second player

    • assignColour3

      private void assignColour3​(Player player1, Player player2, Player player3)
      this function assigns colours to the players passed, from the youngest to the oldest
      Parameters:
      player1 - is the first player
      player2 - is the second player
      player3 - is the third player

    • isNotPlayerTurn

      public boolean isNotPlayerTurn​(Player player)
      Checks that current player's colour is equals to current turn's colour or not
      Parameters:
      player - is the player to test
      Returns:
      boolean that says if it not that player's turn

      public void updateTurn​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players)

      Parameters:

    • updateTurnColour

      private void updateTurnColour()
      updates the turn colour based on the players still in game

    • getPlayerFromColour

      public Player getPlayerFromColour​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players, Colour colour)
      Parameters:
      players - is the list of player in the game
      colour - is the colour to search between the players' colours
      Returns:
      the players whose colour corresponds to the one passed to the method

    • isEliminated

      public boolean isEliminated​(Player player)
      Parameters:
      player - is the player whose elimination state has to be checked
      Returns:
      a boolean which says if the player is eliminated

    • setEliminated

      public void setEliminated​(Player player)
      marks the player passed as eliminated by changing the elimination status of his colour
      Parameters:
      player - is the player to mark as eliminated

    • removeFromGame

      public void removeFromGame​(Player player)
      removes the player's worker from the board, and calls setEliminated
      Parameters:
      player - is the player to remove from the game

    • getPlayersLeft

      public int getPlayersLeft()

    • getWinnerColour

      public Colour getWinnerColour()
      this method is called when only one player is left as a consequence of another player's elimination
      Returns:
      the first not eliminated colour, following the colour order, which is the colour of the last player left

    • declareWinner

      public void declareWinner​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players)
      given the list of players, it return the winner and notifies the virtualviw with the win message and the enOfGame message
      Parameters:
      players - is the list of players

    • performLoseCheck

      public boolean performLoseCheck​(Player player, int chosenWorker, java.lang.String phase)
      checks if a player lost, in that case the player is removed from the game, then the elimination message and the updated gamebard are sent to the players through the VirtualView
      Parameters:
      player - is the player who is trying to move/build
      chosenWorker - is the worker number
      phase - is move/build, to select the right LoseStrategy for that player
      Returns:
      a boolen which tells if the playerlost

    • performWinCheck

      public boolean performWinCheck​(Player player, int chosenWorker)
      checks if the player has won, based on his card's winStrategy. If he does, everyone is notified through the VirtualView
      Parameters:
      player - is the player's whose win condition must be checked
      chosenWorker - is the number of the worker which may have won
      Returns:
      a boolean that tells if the player won or not

    • performMoveCheck

      public java.lang.String performMoveCheck​(Player player, int chosenWorker, int[] movingTo)
      checks if the move requested is possible. The player's godCard move strategy check is called
      Parameters:
      player - is the player who is trying to move
      chosenWorker - is the worker to be moved
      movingTo - is the cell in which the player wants to move
      Returns:
      a string describing the error or "ok" if the move is allowed

    • performMove

      public java.lang.String performMove​(Player player, int chosenWorker, int[] movingTo)
      the worker is moved by calling the player god's move strategy
      Parameters:
      player - is the player who is trying to move
      chosenWorker - is the worker to be moved
      movingTo - is the cell in which the player wants to move
      Returns:
      the string containing the next step in the player's turn

    • performBuildCheck

      public java.lang.String performBuildCheck​(Player player, int chosenWorker, int[] buildingInto, java.lang.String pieceType)
      checks if the build requested is possible. The player's godCard build strategy check is called
      Parameters:
      player - is the player who is trying to build
      chosenWorker - is the worker with which the player wants to build
      buildingInto - is the cell in which the player wants to build
      pieceType - is "block" or "dome"
      Returns:
      a string describing the error or "ok" if the build is allowed

    • performBuild

      public java.lang.String performBuild​(Player player, int chosenWorker, int[] buildingInto, java.lang.String pieceType)
      the worker builds by calling the player god's build strategy
      Parameters:
      player - is the player who is trying to build
      chosenWorker - is the worker with which the player wants to build
      buildingInto - is the cell in which the player wants to build
      pieceType - is "block" or "dome"
      Returns:
      the string containing the next step in the player's turn

    • selectGameCards

      public void selectGameCards​(java.lang.String[] names)
      this method moves the selected gods from the main deck to the game deck. check on name validity is done client-side
      Parameters:
      names - is a string vector containing the names of the gods chosen by the player

    • chooseOwnCard

      public void chooseOwnCard​(Player player, java.lang.String name)
      this method moves the removes the god from the main deck and assigns it to the player who requested it check on name validity is done client-side
      Parameters:
      name - is the god's name
      player - is the player who chose that god

    • getIndexFromColour

      public int getIndexFromColour​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players, Colour colour)
      return the index in the list of the player whose colour corresponds to the one passed
      Parameters:
      players - is the list of players in the game
      colour - is the colour to search
      Returns:
      the player's index

    • checkStartingPlacement

      public java.lang.String checkStartingPlacement​(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      makes sure that the starting position selected is a valid one
      Parameters:
      x1 - is the x coordinate of the worker 0
      y1 - is the y coordinate of the worker 0
      x2 - is the x coordinate of the worker 1
      y2 - is the y coordinate of the worker 1
      Returns:
      a string containing the error, or "ok" if the positioning is possible

    • placeOnBoard

      public void placeOnBoard​(Player player, int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      the workers are set on the gameboard. The new board state is then notified
      Parameters:
      player - is the player who is positioning his workers
      x1 - is the x coordinate of the worker 0
      y1 - is the y coordinate of the worker 0
      x2 - is the x coordinate of the worker 1
      y2 - is the y coordinate of the worker 1

    • setColour

      public void setColour​(Colour c)
      For testing purpose only
      Parameters:
      c - turn's colour

    • setEliminated

      public void setEliminated​(int i)
      * For testing purpose only
      Parameters:
      i - is the number of the player to set as eliminated
